page.title: 05CHURCHES
page.content: { { {ST.Mary's CHURCH.}Its tall spire stands proudly between the old village and the Council estate in Suffolk Lane and can be clearly seen from most of the parish.It was consecrated in 1852, so it is not very old.Most of the church services are held here. Picturesque views can be seen from the churchyard- especially of the Abberley Hills and the valley leading to Stourport. {Public Houses.}The village "pub" is in the old village now called the {MANOR {ARMS}previously called the {Bromley {Arms}and is very old. Another public house is a mile and a half from Abberley,on the Clows Top road straddling the parish boundary of Pensax and Abberley.It is another small country pub called {THE BELL.}
